alert.note: Alert for Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 8:14AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washington, southern Wayne and northeastern Greene Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 813 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Ovett, or 13 miles north of Richton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clara, State Line and Buckatunna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
